summary: The SECURE American Telecommunications Act (H.R. 3479) focuses on improving the licensing and security of submarine and cross-border terrestrial telecommunications cables. It mandates stricter licensing, reporting requirements for incidents and repairs, and establishes minimum cybersecurity standards for these cables. The bill also includes provisions the establishment of submarine cable protection zones and increases penalties for damaging submarine cables. Furthermore, it aims to streamline licensing processes and make the FCC a member of the International Cable Protection Committee.
